creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: unsigned; Chapter 22, Tamakazura, At the end of the year Murasaki and Genji make a distribution of stuff for spring clothes to the ladies of Genji's household. Chapter 28, Nawaki (?), The Typhoon, Yoguri sees the ladies-in-waiting to the Empress in her garden after the typhoon giving the cicadas their sip of morning dew and wandering among the flower beds with their baskets over their arms.
medium: Ink, color, and gold on paper
title: The "Jeweled Chaplet" and "Typhoon" Chapters from the Tale of Genji
